Hi! I'm Rita, a UK-based data visualisation designer and scientific illustrator. I have several years of experienced in data analysis and data visualisation. I have a a scientific background with a master in Physics and a PhD in Crystallography. I worked fo several years in academia and I have a deep understanding of scientific research. During these years I continuously tried to improve my illustration skill with course at "Ecole des beaux-arts de Grenoble" and courses at UAL in London and in natural history illustration with the University of Newcastle.

Now I seek a new challenge in data visualisation and scientific illustration.

```{r, echo=FALSE, eval=FALSE, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, fig.width= 12, fig.height=8}
library(tidyverse)
library(streamgraph)
library(lubridate)
library(RColorBrewer)
data <- read_csv("data/parcours-Table 1.csv", 
                 col_names = TRUE)
data <- data[,1:6] %>%
  separate(Years, sep = "-", into = c("Years_s", "Years_e"))  %>%
  mutate(Years_s = my(Years_s),
         Years_e = my(Years_e),
         Year = year(Years_s),
         months = interval(Years_s, Years_e) %/% months(1))
pp <- streamgraph(data, key = "Fonctions", 
                  value = "months",
                  date = "Year",
                  height="300px", 
                  width="1000px",
                  offset="wiggle") %>%
  sg_axis_x(20, "Year", "%Y") %>%
  sg_annotate(label = "France", 
              x = as.Date("2009", format = "%Y"),
              y = 20) %>%
  sg_annotate(label = "Switzerland", 
              x = as.Date("2011", format = "%Y"),
              y = 35) %>%
  sg_annotate(label = "France", 
              x = as.Date("2012", format = "%Y"),
              y = 30) %>%
  sg_annotate(label = "UK", 
              x = as.Date("2013", format = "%Y"),
              y = 47) %>%
  sg_legend(show=TRUE, label="names: ")
```
